stem: A patient with laceration 5 cm proximal to the wrist on the ulnar side has numbness over the dorsum of the ring and little fingers but intact hypothenar strength. Which nerve branch was transected?

choices.A: Dorsal cutaneous branch of the ulnar nerve
choices.B: Deep motor branch of the ulnar nerve
choices.C: Palmar cutaneous branch of the median nerve

rationale_correct: A proximal ulnar laceration spared the motor branch but transected the dorsal cutaneous branch, causing dorsal ring and little finger numbness with preserved hypothenar function.

rationale_distractors.B: Deep motor branch injury would weaken hypothenar muscles.
rationale_distractors.C: Median palmar cutaneous branch supplies the central palm, not dorsal digits.
rationale_distractors.D: Posterior interosseous nerve involves dorsal forearm motor function.
rationale_distractors.E: Lateral antebrachial cutaneous nerve supplies lateral forearm sensation.
